body_html: @Officium yes, subtraction is the operation with worst numerical properties here, but your example doesn't hold, because we're unable to replace it with addition. What really happens is that you still get the loss of precision, but the absolute loss you see is smaller if you do it on smaller numbers (relative errors stay the same).

body: @Officium yes, subtraction is the operation with worst numerical properties here, but your example doesn't hold, because we're unable to replace it with addition. What really happens is that you still get the loss of precision, but the *absolute* loss you see is smaller if you do it on smaller numbers (relative errors stay the same).
